verses.roman:
śata śata śiṣya saṅge sadā adhyāpana
vyākhyā śuni sarva-lokera camakita mana

synonyms: śata śata—very many; śiṣya—disciples; saṅge—along with Him; sadā—always; adhyāpana—studying; vyākhyā—explanation; śuni—hearing; sarva-lokera—of all people; camakita—astonished; mana—minds.
translation: As soon as the Lord became a teacher, many, many students came to Him, every one of them astonished to hear His mode of explanation.
